title.narrative: Emergency health assistance to mothers, new-borns and children displaced from the Federally Administered Tribal Areas (FATA) residing in camps in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (KP) and FATA

description.narrative: 5. More than 80% of targeted 120 pregnant women are assisted through delivery by skilled birth attendants. 6. More than 70% of 120 targeted women undergo least one post natal visit with skilled birth attendants (SBAs) at the facility or community level. 7. More than 60% of 2,248 PLW receive health and hygiene messages through social mobilizers and facility-based health workers. 8. One Solar refrigerator is installed in MCH center in Jalozai and PHC center Togh Sarai each 9. Relevant IEC Material including Banners and Flyers reporting and recording tools provided to IPs for display and distribution in the communities.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

name.narrative: Jalozai and Togh Sarai IDP Camps located in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa and New Durrani Camp in Kurram Agency of FATA and IDPs living with host communities in Kurram Agency of FATA, Pakistan

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Emergency health assistance to mothers, new-borns and children displaced from the Federally Administered Tribal Areas (FATA) residing in camps in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (KP) and FATA

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.
